property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={294, 231, 1076, 632}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value:
Synthesis speech using the Mary Text To Speech web service. Type text into the "Text" accessor and run the model to hear speech.
This demo uses the public web service. If we use this a lot, we should install MaryTTS locally. Documentation: http://mary.dfki.de:59125/documentation.html To download: http://mary.dfki.de/ License: LGPL3.
The model stops after 10 seconds. For longer text, please increase the DEDirector stop time.
This model uses the default voice. Other voices are available.

property.name: text
property.value: See the AudioCapture model.

property.name: text
property.value: Author: Elizabeth Osyk

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: An accessor for playing a sound clip from a URL.

property.name: author
property.value: Elizabeth Osyk (beth@berkeley.edu)

property.name: start (port)
property.value: A trigger input to start playback. The value is ignored and can be anything.

property.name: stop (port)
property.value: A trigger to stop playback. The value is ignored and can be anything.

property.name: clipURL (port)
property.value: The URL to retrieve the sound clip from.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks and Edward A. Lee. Based on TestSpontaneous by Edward A. Lee

property.name: version
property.value: $$Id: TestSpontaneousOnce.js 1659 2017-05-09 14:26:57Z cxh $$

property.name: output (port)
property.value: The output port

property.name: delay (parameter)
property.value: The delay in milliseconds before the value is outputk.

property.name: value (parameter)
property.value: The value to be output after the delay.
